Class Golfers

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Golfers
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Golfers.java A class representing the GUI used in a maintaining a golfers database. 
        Project: Golfers Database
    Platform: jdk 1.6.0_14; NetBeans IDE 6.8; Mac OSx
    Course: CS 143
    Hours: 16 hours
    Created on May 12, 2013, 10:00:00 PM
    See Also:
    Toolkit, ArrayList, IOException, AddEditFormJDialog, Golfer, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setIcon

        private void setIcon(java.lang.String picFile)
        Method: setIcon Sets the Icon of the player to the given String path. Stretches or shrinks the Icon to 190 x 325. The closer the source image is to this size the less distortion there will be.
        Parameters:
        picFile - absolute path of jpeg or jpg file
        See Also:
        showGolferData(int)

      • getScaledImage

        private java.awt.Image getScaledImage(java.awt.Image srcImg,
                            int w,
                            int h)
        Scales the passed image to fit in the playerPicJLabel panel.
        Parameters:
        srcImg - image to be scaled
        w - width to scale to
        h - heigth to scale to
        Returns:
        Image of size [w,h]
        See Also:
        setIcon(java.lang.String)

      • readFromFile

        private void readFromFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                java.lang.String previousFile)
        Method: readFromFile Reads golfers from a text file that is comma delimited and creates an instance of the Golfer class with the data read. Then the newly created golfer is added to the golfers database. Uses an object from the ReadFile class to read record.
        See Also:
        ReadFile, Golfer, fileName

      • displayGolfers

        public void displayGolfers()
        Method: displayGolfers Displays golfers in JList sorted by level = 0 using selection sort algorithm or last name = 1 using the insertion sort algorithm. pre-condition: Uses the ArrayList golfers. post-condition: golfers ArrayList is sorted and displayed either by level or last name.
        See Also:
        selectionSort(java.util.ArrayList<GolferData.Golfer>), insertionSort(java.util.ArrayList<GolferData.Golfer>)

      • insertionSort

        public static void insertionSort(java.util.ArrayList<Golfer> golfers)
        Method: insertionSort Sorts ArrayList golfers in ascending order by Last Name. Uses the insertion sort algorithm which inserts golfer at correct position and shuffles everyone else below that position.

      • selectionSort

        public void selectionSort(java.util.ArrayList<Golfer> golfers)
        Method: selectionSort Sorts ArrayList golfers in descending order by rank. Calls findMinimum to find golfer with maximum population in each pass and swap to exchange golfers when necessary.

      • findMinimum

        public int findMinimum(java.util.ArrayList<Golfer> golfers,
              int i)
        Method: findMinimum Called by selectionSort to find the index of the member with the minimum level from a given index to the beginning of the ArrayList
        Returns:
        int: position or index where maximum is located pre-condition: ArrayList golfers filled-in with golfers objects, int i >= 0. post-condition: golfers ArrayList is sorted by level.

      • swap

        public static void swap(java.util.ArrayList<Golfer> golfers,
        int i,
        int j)
        Method: swap Called by selectionSort to find the index of the member with the maximum level from a given index to the end of the ArrayList

      • showGolferData

        private void showGolferData(int index)
        Displays Golfer information in the JTetFields and displays an associated player portrait.
        See Also:
        displayGolfers()

      • writeToFile

        private void writeToFile()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Method: writeToFile Write golfers to a text file that is comma delimited.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        WriteFile, Golfer

        private void saveGolfers()

        Parameters:
        fileName - file to be written to.
        See Also:
        Golfer, #writeToFile(java.lang.String)

        Parameters:
        newMember: - Member to be added to database
        isCompleted: - Boolean y/n if the add member prompt was successful Pre-condition: A valid member object and a boolean value y/n Post-condition: tempNewMember now holds the member object to be added to the database as well as a boolean variable indicating if the adding process was completed.

      • golferExists

        private boolean golferExists(Golfer golfer)
        Determines if the golfer passed already exists in the golfers Database, based on name.
        Parameters:
        golfer - Golfer to be added to Database
        Returns:
        boolean value representing whether or not the golfer already exists
        See Also:
        Golfer, #replaceGolfer(GolferData.Golfer), addNewMember(), addNewGolferComplete

                 Golfer oldGolfer,
                 Golfer newGolfer)

        Parameters:

      • addTeam

        private void addTeam()
        Creates a new Team of players and prompts the user for the file to which they would like to save the new team.
        See Also:
        addNewMember(), saveAs()

      • saveAs

        private void saveAs()
        Saves the currently displayed team of golfers to a file of the user's choice, if the file already exists prompts user for overwrite.
        See Also:
        JFileChooser, #saveJMenuIteme, addTeam()

      • fileExists

        private int fileExists()
        Determines if the chosen file already exists in the directory.
        Returns:
        int representing approval or denial of unchecked file save
        See Also:
        saveAs(), addTeam()

      • setRanks

        private void setRanks()
        Sets the team ranks of the current team to start at 1 and increase by a value of 1 incrementally. Gets rid of the gaps in ranks should the user desire.
        See Also:
        sort(java.util.ArrayList), swapRanks()

      • sort

        public static void sort(java.util.ArrayList v)
        Sorts the ArrayList passed by team rank.
        Parameters:
        v - Array List of players with value level or rank to be sorted by
        See Also:
        setRanks()

      • swapRanks

        private void swapRanks()
        Switches the currently selected player's rank with the desired rank, should it already exist on the same team, and displays the new team in the JList.
        See Also:
        sort(java.util.ArrayList), setRanks()
